text: thumb|250x250px| An exhibit depicting Exilarch Huna at the Beth Hatefutsoth. The exilarch was the leader of the in Persian Mesopotamia (modern-day Iraq) for most of the time from the Parthians era, Sassanid Empire, and the Abbasid Caliphate, until the Mongol invasion of Baghdad in 1258. == Footnotes == == Other websites == * Iranian Encyclopedia on Exilarchs under Arab rule * Jewish Virtual Library- Exilarch * Early Babylonian Exilarchate- GOTHOD * Revolutionary article by professor M. Gintzler of Yeshivat Chevron: "שלשלת ראשי גולת בבל מחורבן בית ראשון ועד המאה ה־14" in Mekhilta IV Sep 2022 https://www.academia.edu/89141205 Hebrew University of Jerusalem Category:Jewish politicians Category:Iraqi Jews
title: Exilarch
